intro: Armeria euscadiensis, commonly known as the Euskal armeria, is a flowering plant native to the Basque region of Spain and southwestern France. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its pink or white flowers bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its natural habitat. Armeria euscadiensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
